creditline: Gift of Melvin L. Bedrick in honor of Izzika Gaon
description: palm leaves in blues, greens, pink, red, orange and yellow; symbol in purple in LRC
image_copyright: Copyright © Sheila Hicks. All rights reserved.
text: In the early 1980s, artist Sheila Hicks received a commission to create more than fifty artworks for the King Saud University in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This radiantly hued textile, titled Palm, is a smaller version of the large-scale tapestry that Hicks created for the university’s auditorium. As a primary symbol of the region’s natural resources, the palm tree is a central feature of the national emblem of Saudi Arabia, and, in Hicks’ tapestry, where yellow, blue-green, and purple fronds stretch from top to bottom.
title: Palm
